It was from my own Elizabeth:—<p
even the constant letters of dear kind Henry are not sufficient
pen; yet one word from you, dear Victor, is necessary to calm our apprehensions. For a long time I have thought that each post would bring this line, and my persuasions have restrained my uncle from

I have prevented his encountering the inconveniences and perhaps dangers of so long a journey; yet how often have I regretted not being able to perform it myself! I figure to myself that the task of attending on your sick bed has devolved on some mercenary old nurse, who could never guess your wishes, nor minister to them with the care and affection of your poor cousin. Yet that
>“Get well—and return to us. You will find a happy, cheerful home, and friends who love you dearly
he asks but to see you,—but to be assured
you are well; and not a care will ever cloud his benevolent countenance. How pleased you would be to remark
sixteen, and full of activity and spirit. He
to enter into foreign service; but we cannot part with him
pleased with the idea of a military career in a distant country; but
application. He looks upon study as an odious fetter
will become an idler, unless we yield the point,
permit him to enter on the
>“Little alteration, except the growth of our dear children, has taken place since you left us. The blue lake, and snow
clad mountains, they never change;—and I think our placid home
our contented hearts are regulated by
My trifling occupations take up my time and amuse me,
I am rewarded for any exertions by seeing none but happy
kind faces around me. Since you left us
but one change has taken place in our
but my anxiety returns upon me as I conclude
—one line—one word will be a blessing to us. Ten thousand thanks to Henry for his kindness, his affection, and his many letters: we are sincerely grateful. Adieu!
cousin; take care of yourself; and, I entreat you

application. He looks upon study as an odious fetter

>“Little alteration, except the growth of our dear children, has taken place since you left us. The blue lake, and snow
clad mountains, they never change;—and I think our placid home
our contented hearts are regulated by
My trifling occupations take up my time and amuse me,
I am rewarded for any exertions by seeing none but happy
kind faces around me. Since you left us
but one change has taken place in our
but my anxiety returns upon me as I conclude
—one line—one word will be a blessing to us. Ten thousand thanks to Henry for his kindness, his affection, and his many letters: we are sincerely grateful. Adieu!
cousin; take care of yourself; and, I entreat you
I cannot describe to you the uneasiness we
all this time you have been obliged to dictate your letters
Henry. Surely, Victor, you must have been exceedingly ill;
wretched, as much so nearly as after the death of
almost persuaded that you were indeed dangerously ill,
indeed, indeed, Victor, we are all very miserable on this account. Relieve us from
fear, and we shall be the happiest creatures in the world
he appears ten years younger since last winter. Ernest also
improved, that you would hardly know him: he is now nearly sixteen
sickly appearance which he had some years ago; he is grown quite robust and
and I conversed a long time last night about what profession
should follow. His constant illness when young has deprived him of the habits
application; and now that he enjoys good health, he is continually
should be a farmer; which you know,
, is a favourite scheme of mine. A farmer’s is a very healthy happy life;
the least hurtful, or rather the most beneficial

of any. My uncle had an idea of his being educated as an advocate, that through his interest he might become a judge. But, besides that he is not at all fitted for such an occupation, it is certainly more creditable to cultivate the earth for the sustenance of man, than to be the confidant
sometimes the accomplice, of his vices; which is

employments of a prosperous farmer, if they were not a more honourable, they were at least a happier species of occupation than that of a judge, whose misfortune it was always to meddle with the dark side of human nature. My uncle smiled
and said, that I ought to be an advocate myself
which put an end to the conversation on that subject.<p/>
<p/>“And now I must tell you a
After what I have said, I dare say you well remember the heroine of my little tale: for Justine
yet I cannot conclude without again anxiously inquiring concerning your health
if you are not very ill
write yourself, and make your father and all of us happy; or——I cannot bear to think of the other side of the question; my tears already flow. Adieu, my dearest cousin.<p

I perceive that your father <del sID="novel1_letter4_chapter5_div4_div5_p3_add1_del1"/>conceals<del eID="novel1_letter4_chapter5_div4_div5_p3_add1_del1"/> attempts to conceal his fears from me; but cheerfulness has flown from our little circle, only

<lb n="c56-0061__main__8"/> <del rend="strikethrough" xml:id="c56-0061.05" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12901"/>her to<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12901"/> <mod sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12905"/>
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>
to <mod eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12905"/> <anchor xml:id="c56-0061.04"/>
an<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12919"/>d<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12919"/> education <lb n="c56-0061__main__9"/>

which she <mod sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12924"/>
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>
had <mod eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12924"/> at <lb n="c56-0061__main__10"/>
I do not mean that she
lips <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12965"/>w<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12965"/> but <lb n="c56-0061__main__16"/>
attention to every gesture of my

<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e13029"/>very<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e13029"/> often <mod sID="c56-0061__main__d2e13032"/> <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e13034"/>puts<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e13034"/> <anchor xml:id="c56-0061.03"/> <zone corresp="#c56-0061.03" type="left_margin" sID="c56-0061__left_margin"/> <lb n="c56-0061__left_margin__1"/>
reminds<zone eID="c56-0061__left_margin"

<mod eID="c56-0061__main__d2e13032"/> <lb n="c56-0061__main__25"/> me <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e13050"/>in mind<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e13050"/> of her. <delSpan rend="vertical_line" spanTo="#c56-0061.07"/> <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e13055"

>You did not<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e13055"/> observe <lb n="c56-0061__main__26"/> all this, nor did I at the time but <lb n="c56-0061__main__27"/> it struck me afterwards when I <lb n="c56-0061__main__28"/> reflected on the subject.<anchor xml:id="c56-0061.07"/> <milestone unit="tei:p"/> <lb n="c56-0061__main__29"/> When
one was too much occupied in

their<zone eID="c56-0061__main"/> <surface eID="ox-ms_abinger_c56-0061"/> <surface lrx="5364" lry="7104" partOf="#ox-frankenstein_volume_i" ulx="0" uly="0" folio="28b verso" shelfmark="MS. Abinger c. 56" base="ox-ms_abinger_c56/ox-ms_abinger_c56-0062.xml" id="ox-ms_abinger_c56-0062" sID="ox-ms_abinger_c56-0062"/> <graphic url="http://shelleygodwinarchive.org/images/ox/ms_abinger_c56/ms_abinger_c56-0062.jp2"/> <zone type="main" sID="c56-0062__main"/> <lb n="c56-0062__main__1"/> own <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0062__main__d2e13083"/>grif<del eID="c56-0062__main__d2e13083"/>
who had attended her during her
deaths of her favourites was a
partialli<mod sID="c56-0062__main__d2e13133"/> <mdel>n</mdel> t <mod eID="c56-0062__main__d2e13133"/>y <lb n="c56-0062__main__14"/> she
she was much altered since the
soft<mod sID="c56-0062__main__d2e13193"/> <mdel>e</mdel> n <mod eID="c56-0062__main__d2e13193"/>ess <lb n="c56-0062__main__22"/> and
<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0062__main__d2e13216"/>fo<del eID="c56-0062__main__d2e13216"/> wo <lb n="c56-0062__main__27"/> man

unkindness<zone eID="c56-0062__main"/> <surface eID="ox-ms_abinger_c56-0062"/> <surface lrx="5364" lry="7104" partOf="#ox-frankenstein_volume_i" ulx="0" uly="0" folio="29r" shelfmark="MS. Abinger c. 56" base="ox-ms_abinger_c56/ox-ms_abinger_c56-0063.xml" id="ox-ms_abinger_c56-0063" sID="ox-ms_abinger_c56-0063"/> <graphic url="http://shelleygodwinarchive.org/images/ox/ms_abinger_c56/ms_abinger_c56-0063.jp2"/> <zone type="main" sID="c56-0063__main"/> <lb n="c56-0063__main__1"/>
<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13237"/>h<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13237"/> her <lb n="c56-0063__main__3"/> brothers andamp;

<lb n="c56-0063__main__7"/> rest for ever; <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13254"/>for<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13254"/> <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13257"/> <unclear>S</unclear> <del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13257"/> she <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13264"/>did<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13264"/> died <lb n="c56-0063__main__8"/>

th<mod sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13271"/> <mdel>e</mdel> is <mod eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13271"/> <mod sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13280"/>
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>
<mod eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13280"/> winter <delSpan rend="strikethrough" spanTo="#c56-0063.01"/>that <lb n="c56-0063__main__10"/> has just passed<anchor xml:id="c56-0063.01"/>
I love her tenderly. She is very
mild andamp; pretty and as <lb n="c56-0063__main__14"/>

before <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13308"/>she<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13308"/> <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13311"/>is<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13311"/> her <mod sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13314"/> <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13316"/>air<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13316"/> mein <mod eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13314"/> and <lb n="c56-0063__main__15"/> <anchor xml:id="c56-0063.02"/> <zone corresp="#c56-0063.02" type="left_margin" sID="c56-0063__left_margin"/> <lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__1"
her <zone eID="c56-0063__left_margin"/>expressions <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13336"/>are<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13336"/> continually remind me <lb n="c56-0063__main__16"
> of my dear Aunt.<milestone unit="tei:p"/> <lb n="c56-0063__main__17"/> <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13345"/>And<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13345"/> I
<lb n="c56-0063__main__21"/> blue eyes <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13357"/>and<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13357"/> dark eyelashes

<lb n="c56-0063__main__24"/> with health — his chin comes down in <lb n="c56-0063__main__25"/> a beautiful oval <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13369"/>a<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13369"/> After this <w ana="start"/>descrip<lb n="c56-0063__main__26"/>tion<w ana="end"/> I can only say what our visitors <lb n="c56-0063__main__27"/> say a thousand times a day–'He is too <lb n="c56-0063__main__28"/> pretty for a boy'

<mod sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13383"/>
<metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0063.03">X</metamark> <zone corresp="#c56-0063.03" type="left_margin" sID="c56-0063__left_margin"/>
<lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__1"/>

<lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__5"/> <mdel>M</mdel> <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__left_margin__d2e13411"/> <unclear>Caln</unclear> <del eID="c56-0063__left_margin__d2e13411"/> Biron <lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__6"/>

dare<zone eID="c56-0063__main"/> <surface eID="ox-ms_abinger_c56-0063"/> <surface lrx="5364" lry="7104" partOf="#ox-frankenstein_volume_i" ulx="0" uly="0" folio="29v" shelfmark="MS. Abinger c. 56" base="ox-ms_abinger_c56/ox-ms_abinger_c56-0064.xml" id="ox-ms_abinger_c56-0064" sID="ox-ms_abinger_c56-0064"/> <graphic url="http://shelleygodwinarchive.org/images/ox/ms_abinger_c56/ms_abinger_c56-0064.jp2"/> <zone type="main" sID="c56-0064__main"/> <lb n="c56-0064__main__1"/> say <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0064__main__d2e13452"/>I<del eID="c56-0064__main__d2e13452"/>
you wish to be indulged in a little
gossip concerning the good people of Geneva

<lb n="c56-0064__main__4"/> <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0064__main__d2e13462"/>on<del eID="c56-0064__main__d2e13462"/> <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0064__main__d2e13465"/>her<del eID="c56-0064__main__d2e13465"/> the congratulatory
yet I cannot conclude without again anxiously inquiring concerning your health
but my anxiety returns upon me as I conclude
if you are not very ill
—one line—one word will be a blessing to us. Ten thousand thanks to Henry for his kindness, his affection, and his many letters: we are sincerely grateful. Adieu!

Cousin yet I can not conclude <lb n="c56-0064__main__22"/> without again anxiously enquiring <lb n="c56-0064__main__23"/> concerning your health— Dear Victor, if <lb n="c56-0064__main__24"/> you are not very ill write yourself <lb n="c56-0064__main__25"/> and make your father and all <lb n="c56-0064__main__26"/> of us happy or— I cannot bear to <anchor xml:id="c56-0064.01"/> <zone corresp="#c56-0064.01" type="left_margin" sID="c56-0064__left_margin"/>
<lb n="c56-0064__left_margin__1"/> think <mod sID="c56-0064__left_margin__d2e13557"/> <mdel>of</mdel>
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>
on <mod eID="c56-0064__left_margin__d2e13557"/> the <lb n="c56-0064__left_margin__2"/> other side <lb n="c56-0064__left_margin__3"/> of the question <lb n="c56-0064__left_margin__4"/>
cousin; take care of yourself; and, I entreat you
write yourself, and make your father and all of us happy; or——I cannot bear to think of the other side of the question; my tears already flow. Adieu, my dearest cousin.<p

tears <w ana="start"/>al<lb n="c56-0064__left_margin__5"/>ready<w ana="end"/> flow<anchor xml:id="c56-0064.02"/> <zone eID="c56-0064__left_margin"/> <lb n="c56-0064__main__27"/> Your very affectionate Cousin <lb n="c56-0064__main__28"/> <milestone next="#c56-0064.04" spanTo="#c56-0064.03" unit="tei:seg"
<comment text=" RM: location and date are 2 points smaller than body text "/>
> <milestone spanTo="#c56-0064.05" unit="tei:seg" xml:id="c56-0064.04"/>write–<anchor xml:id="c56-0064.05"/> <zone eID="c56-0064__main"/> <surface eID="ox-ms_abinger_c56-0064"

<note sID="novel1_letter4_chapter5_div4_div5_note1"/>This letter ought to be re-written.<note eID="novel1_letter4_chapter5_div4_div5_note1"/> <!--2018-04-25 ebb: This collation unit is identical to the 1818 text (no changes in Thomas copy here).-->
